dosageInstruction.text:
2.4 mg (1.5 mg/m2 × 1.59 m2), Intravenous, ONCE, Mon 4/1/13 at 1130, For 1 dose
Use caution with PIV administration.  This solution has a pH < 5, or a pH > 9, or an osmolality > 600 mOsm/L.

8 mg (5 mg/m2 × 1.59 m2), Oral, 2 times daily, First dose on Mon 4/1/13 at 1100, For 28 doses
Food Alert:  effects glucose, sodium and fluids.

16 mg, Oral, ONCE, Mon 4/1/13 at 1100, For 1 dose
Do not attempt to push tablet through foil backing. With dry hands peel back  the foil backing and gently remove tablet. Immediately place the tablet on the  where it will dissolve in seconds, then swallow with saliva. Administration with liquid is not necessary.

3,975 Int'l Units (2,500 Int'l Units/m2 × 1.59 m2), Intramuscular, Every 24 hours, First dose on Thu 4/4/13 at 1000, For 1 dose
Day 4.  Oncaspar = pegASPARgase.  Observe for signs of allergic response for at least 2 hours.

70 mg, Intrathecal, Once, Mon 4/1/13 at 1100, For 1 dose
Age less than 1 year = Dose: cytarabine 20 mg. Age 1 - 1.99 years = Dose: cytarabine 30 mg. Age 2 - 2.99 years = Dose: cytarabine 50 mg. Age greater than or equal to 3 years = Dose: cytarabine 70 mg.
